remarks: If ` B ` is not a limit point of the domain of the function ` F ` , then every point is a limit of ` F ` at ` B ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Dec-2016.)
statement:
limccl.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> CC ) $.
limccl.a $e |- ( ph -> A C_ CC ) $.
limccl.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. CC ) $.
ellimc2.k $e |- K = ( TopOpen ` CCfld ) $.
limcnlp.n $e |- ( ph -> -. B e. ( ( limPt ` K ) ` A ) ) $.
limcnlp $p |- ( ph -> ( F limCC B ) = CC ) $.
